headers.subject: [tosdr:613] [Good] Amazon has a good refund policy
headers.x-original-authentication-results: ls.google.com; spf=pass (google.com: domain of seppo0010@gmail.com designates internal as permitted sender) smtp.mail=seppo0010@gmail.com; dkim=pass header.i=@gmail.com

html:
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_901888_ref_how?nodeId=901926
Partial refunds/Restocking Fees
Any unopened media item or non-media item in original condition that is returned more than 30 days after delivery: you'll receive 80% of item's price.
Any book that has obvious signs of use: you'll receive 50% of item's price.
Any CD, DVD, VHS tape, software, video game, cassette tape, or vinyl record that has been opened (taken out of its plastic wrap): you'll receive 50% of item's price.
Any item that is not in its original condition, is damaged, or is missing parts for reasons not due to our error: you'll receive up to 50% of item's price.

In my experience they do make refunds or send again books that didn't arrive properly.
They do have a system in place to ask for refunds[1].

[1] http://www.amazon.com/gp/css/returns/homepage.html/ref=hy_f_4

--
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR

subject: [Good] Amazon has a good refund policy
text:
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_901888_ref_how?nodeId=901926

> Partial refunds/Restocking Fees
> Any unopened media item or non-media item in original condition that is 
> returned more than 30 days after delivery: you'll receive 80% of item's 
> price.
> Any book that has obvious signs of use: you'll receive 50% of item's price.
> Any CD, DVD, VHS tape, software, video game, cassette tape, or vinyl 
> record that has been opened (taken out of its plastic wrap): you'll receive 
> 50% of item's price.
> Any item that is not in its original condition, is damaged, or is missing 
> parts for reasons not due to our error: you'll receive up to 50% of item's 
> price.


In my experience they do make refunds or send again books that didn't 
arrive properly.
They do have a system in place to ask for refunds[1].

[1] http://www.amazon.com/gp/css/returns/homepage.html/ref=hy_f_4
